intro: Alsodeia cuspa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed alsodeia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly referred to as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually greenish-white and appear in clusters, typically blooming in early spring. Alsodeia cuspa is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
